author: Scott Manley
description:
The SETI Institute (https://www.seti.org/) is a non-profit science foundation that is dedicated to the search for extra terrestrial intelligence, and about 20 years ago they began construction of a telescope array in northern California. This was the Allen Telescope Array, funded by a donation from Microsoft co-Founder Paul Allen
https://www.seti.org/projects/ata/

This year I was invited out for a tour of this facility, but it would be a 4+and hour drive so as soon as my plane came back from the mechanics I put it high on my list of places to go. I was met by Dr Alex Pollak who is in charge of Operations at the facility and knows a lot about the hardware from antennas through to the data center and the power to support this.

Find out more about the SETI Institute here:
https://www.seti.org/

Follow me on Twitter for more updates:
https://twitter.com/DJSnM

I have a discord server where I regularly turn up:
https://discord.gg/zStmKbM

If you really like what I do you can support me d
title: How SETI Designed A Telescope To Look For Extraterrestrial Civilizations
